column3: str

The royal seneschal has the spark of resolve in his eyes.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

The royal seneschal appears to be Peatie's biggest fan, and he invites both her and Aldemund to Ul'dah, that Peatie might be the star attraction of this year's Little Ladies' Day. He requests your assistance in comforting Peatie as she gets used to to the crowds, then departs to Ul'dah to make preparations for her arrival. Aldemund and Peatie have business to attend to in Gridania before they follow, so the performer asks you to go ahead and await their arrival.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

The royal seneschal informs you that the planning committee for Little Ladies' Day has agreed to welcome Peatie with open arms, and now he asks you to help do what you can to spread the same sentiment among the city's populace. He bids you travel to the Steps of Thal and do what you can to drum up interest in the coming entertainment.

While not everyone you speak with is accepting of a goobbue in their city at first, you manage to convince all three citizens you speak with to attend the show, and some even seem excited at the prospect. Who knows how many more they might convince to attend Peatie's performance? All that is left is to visit the stage and report your success to the royal seneschal.

You arrive at the stage in Emerald Avenue to see a crowd much larger than the one in Gridania, all waiting to be entertained. It seems the presence of so many expectant guests has caused Peatie to freeze up, but Aldemund suggests <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>rallying<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> her spirits to shake her out of this fluster.

Although Peatie is initially too frightened to respond to your encouragement, a few heartfelt words manages to break her loose from the clutches of fear and gives her a newfound sense of determination. With the goobbue ready for her big show, all thta is left is for you to join the crowd and cheer for your friend from afar.

Peatie takes the stage and her show dazzles all present, earning the goobbue a hearty applause. As she leaves the stage, you sense a feeling of contentment and pride in Peatie's inscrutable expression. The royal seneschal, however, is more obviously ecstatic with the reaction, and seems eager to thank you for your part in bringing it about.

All present are proud of Peatie's success, but perhaps she is the proudest of all. Realizing that Peatie is meant to keep on this road and that his best days as a performer are behind him, Aldemund asks that you take his goobbue companion along on your adventures. As you look forward to keeping the company of a famous goobbue, the royal seneschal and Jihli Aliapoh both encourage you to enjoy their respective celebrations. With so much merrymaking across the realm, smiles will be guaranteed for moons to come.
Speak with the royal seneschal in Ul'dah.
Speak with the Ul'dahn citizens in the Steps of Thal.
Speak with the royal seneschal at Emerald Avenue.
/rally Peatie's spirits.
Wait at the designated location.
Speak with the royal seneschal.
There's not a single egg left. Good work spreadin' the word, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Grrr!
I see you and Peatie are getting along like eggs and spriggans! I think you would agree that there could be no better an addition to the Little Ladies' Day festivities.
Did you see Peatie do her thing? 'Twas plain to me that she gave her all to getting every detail of the show just perfect. That's exactly the kind of enterprising spirit these festivities need!
Although I've been but a bystander in affairs so far, what I've seen has been truly inspiring. Peatie is possessed not only of a kind heart, but the soul of an entertainer!
I would have her be the main attraction of our stage in Ul'dah! That is, of course, if you do me the honor of accompanying us there as honored guests.
Well, I'm not one to decline such an eager invitation. Consider it accepted.
But first, I'd best tell Miss Aliapoh that she'll be needin' more eggs. Go on to Ul'dah─I reckon we can find our own way there before long.
Thank you, thank you! Then I shall depart at once, and make the stage ready for your arrival.

Ahem. I know you've helped so much already, but there's no denying that Peatie has taken a shine to you. Might you watch over her in Ul'dah for a while─just until she becomes accustomed to the crowds.
Every stage is different, so it might take a while until Peatie feels comfortable. But her desire to see people smile can't be doubted. She'll be the jewel of the sands, I reckon.
Grrr! Hrrr!
Peatie is excited to depart on a new adventure to bring joy to the hearts of the realm's little ladies.
Our lovely Peatie is heading straight from her debut to the grand stage. I must leave at once to cheer her on!
As expected, Lady Aliapoh's dream is coming to fruition. Give the warmest of regards to the royal seneschal for me!
Ah, you are arrived! You'll be glad to know that I've managed to win over the planning committee with my story of Peatie's show. Ul'dah's gates will be cast wide for her arrival!
If she is amenable to the idea, I would have her be the star attraction on this year's stage.
But the first order of the day is to spread the word! If we tell the citizens what we saw in Bentbranch Meadows, they will surely welcome Peatie with open arms.
And if her show is a success, then we will have accomplished something great: a celebration which spans from Gridania to Ul'dah, and does honor to all the ladies and eggs of the realm!

I shall stay here and drum up what interest that I can. <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I would ask that you make your way to the Steps of Thal and do the same. When you've finished, come to the stage and together we can shower Peatie with applause.
Aldemund and Peatie will wait outside the city gates until the appointed time. Until then, it's up to us to spread the word and muster the largest crowd we can.
A goobbue performer? Don't they eat people whole? Well, a friend of mine was raving about the show she saw in Gridania...if it's the very same, I suppose there's no harm in having a look!
A goobbue, here in Ul'dah? <shudder>...That dredges up terrible memories of the rampage I witnessed as a child...there were bodies everywhere.
How do you know that won't happen again? Have you seen this goobbue with your own eyes?
What will you say?
Yes, and it brought countless smiles to the people of Gridania.
Yes, and it's as gentle as a tamed chocobo.
Is that so? Well, I see no reason why you would lie to me... Very well, I shall go. Perhaps afterwards I won't be so afraid of those things...
I didn't know goobbues were capable of anything more than mindless eating. Are you sure this “show” isn't just watching a beast chomping on hay?
What will you say?
The crowds of Gridania gave her a standing ovation.
So what if it is? You'll still have a chance to see a goobbue up close.
Well, when you put it that way... Besides, it's not as if I have aught else to do. All right, look for me among the crowd!
The time of Peatie's performance draws near. Speak with the royal seneschal before the curtains rise.
Grrr...
This crowd's a bit large even for me...I can imagine what Peatie must be feelin'.
Thank you for pulling your weight, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─not that I thought you wouldn't. It seems word spread even further than I had hoped.
And while this is cause for celebration, Peatie appears to be intimidated by their expectant gazes.
Grrr...
'Course, you could just hop up on her head and she'd calm down just like that. But I think we need a more permanent solution to this stage fright of hers.

Why don't you <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>rally<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> her spirits with some kind words, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Seems she's warmed to you, and I'm sure some personal encouragement would knock her right out of this stupor.

Come on, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Rally<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> her spirits like you would your allies before a death-defyin' battle.
She can dazzle them, she just needs to believe...
Truth be told, this is her first time performin' alone in front of so many people. I can see why she'd hesitate to climb on that stage.
What will you say?
Remember how happy you made everyone in Gridania!
Don't worry, Peatie, I'm right here.
Little Ladies' Day needs its princess!
Grrr!
That did the trick! You've got a talent for liftin' the spirits of the downtrodden, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and I'm glad you used it to help my lovely Peatie.
We are in your debt, truly!
It's almost time. Lady Aliapoh should have arrived by now─<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, pray join the bystanders and give Peatie the cheer she deserves!
Grrr...
Peatie is frozen with fright, but she may come to if you <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>rally<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> her spirits.
The show shall start anon. Go on, join the crowd and lend your voice to the cheers!
Your words were like a drop of water on a hot day. I reckon Peatie might even like you more than me!
Grrr!
Peatie is ready to take the stage. Join the other bystanders to see what she has in store for Gridania's little ladies.
And now for the final act! Bedecked in blooming flowers, this goobbue princess has prepared something unforgettable for the little ladies of the realm!
This is just how I envisioned it in my dream!
(-Elegant Citizen-)And to think I ever believed goobbue were naught but wild beasts! Oh, I could just kiss her!
(-Animated Citizen-)If Hatching–tide is even half as thrilling as this show, I'd best catch the next airship to Gridania!
Heh, all's well that ends well. The little ladies get a great show, and Hatching–tide gets more egg seekers.
Their smiles are like so many flowers in full bloom! Peatie will be the talk of Ul'dah for moons to come.
That she will, that she will. I have to thank you, Miss Aliapoh, for givin' us both the chance to bring a little brightness to so many lives.
I've left Nonotta in charge of goings-on in Gridania. Oh, would that she could see my dream come alive! But not even my dream prepared me for such an enthusiastic reception!
I reckon Peatie had the most fun out of everyone here.
Grrr, grrr!
Peatie appears satisfied with the crowd's reaction. It's almost as if she wants to rush back on the stage.
Thank you, Peatie, for bringing joy to the citizens of Ul'dah. And especially the little ladies!
That was better than I could have imagined. Hatching–tide and Little Ladies Day both will be remembered as the highlights of the year!
Couldn't have done it without your help, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We'll both be lookin' back on this experience with fondness for the rest of our lives, I reckon.
I've got to thinkin'...maybe it's time I let Peatie spread her wings, so to speak, and give this performin' business up for good. I think she'd be more than happy by your side, if you'll have her.
As for me, I have it in mind to find a place to settle down and rest these old bones.
Peatie's not at that age, though, and I'd hate to tie her down. If you bring her along on your adventures, she'll be able to deliver smiles to corners of the realm I've only heard tales of.
What will you say?
How could I say no?
Are you sure you'll be okay without her?
Truth be told, I only asked you as a formality, hah. I know I've placed her in good hands with you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Can't deny I already feel the tendrils of loneliness tuggin' at my heart, but they'll lose their grip so long as I know Peatie's with you.
I look forward to hearin' of her exploits as I while the days away.
I don't mean to be rude, but I am required in Gridania. Nonotta must know just how perfectly my dream manifested!
Heh, would that she could have seen it herself. I'll stay here in Ul'dah until the festivities end─and who knows, maybe longer.
And with that, allow me to thank you personally, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. The princesses of Ul'dah could not have asked for a better seneschal.
And neither could Peatie. Seeing you dote upon her so dutifully reminded me why I volunteered for this position in the first place.
Although Peatie's show has concluded, Little Ladies' Day has not! Pray enjoy all that we have prepared.
I expect to see you at Gridania's Hatching–tide, as well!
You have unlocked the Egg Hunter Riggy mini-game. To play mini-games, open the toy chest found in any inn room.
